SENT.plain: Hazards and difficulties of catheter carotid and vertebral angiography are reported
Our experience is based on 257 persons who had undergone 338 carotid and 33 vertebral arteriographies
In 31 patients, bilateral carotid as well as aortic arch and abdominal aortic, iliac and lower limb arteriography were carried out in one session
Our material consists of consecutive cases
The characteristics of the "sidewinder-technique" are emphasized
Several safety measures considered necessary during the examination are described
